result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlen Antwan Snow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges by 02/20/2018, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

With Huber/release privileges for work, 2 days credit.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlen Antwan Snow

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Kremers Br 36 for review. os

Defendant Marlen Antwan Snow in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Marlen Antwan Snow in custody.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.
.
Sentencing continued....
.
  Sentencing proceeds.   

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 5 months at the House of Correction with Huber/release privileges for work, 2 days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges by 02/20/2018, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; defendant is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
